title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct equation.

Ca(OH)2 ⇄ Ca2+ + 2 OH-
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for the correct equation.

Ca(OH)2 ⇄ Ca2+ + 2 OH-

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned for the correct equation.

Ca(OH)2 ⇄ Ca2+ + 2 OH-

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct stoichiometry and setup.

Ksp = [Ca2+] [OH-]2

1.3 x 10-6 = (0.10 + x) (2x)2 ≈ (0.10) 4x2 [assuming x << 0.10]

1.3 x 10-5 = 4x2

x = 0.0018 M

1 point is earned for the final answer.

Molar solubility of Ca(OH)2 = 0.0018 M

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for a correct diagram that shows at least three of the four water molecules oriented as described.

[The diagram should show the oxygen side of the water molecules oriented closer to the Ca2+ ion.]
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for a correct diagram that shows at least three of the four water molecules oriented as described.

[The diagram should show the oxygen side of the water molecules oriented closer to the Ca2+ ion.]

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned for a correct diagram that shows at least three of the four water molecules oriented as described.
